entity.name: COVID-19: Latest news updates from around the world
entity.description: This page is a timeline of Tweets with the latest information and updates on COVID-19 from experts, journalists, health authorities and other trusted sources from around the world. For more on COVID-19, visit: twitter.com/explore/tabs/covid-19

entity.name: World Health Organization declares coronavirus outbreak a public health emergency
entity.description: During a press conference, the WHO's Director-General Dr Tedros declared the coronavirus as a public health emergency of international concern. The announcement is only the sixth time such an emergency has been declared. Speaking in Geneva, Tedros said the "greatest concern is the potential for the virus to spread to countries with weaker health systems and which are ill-prepared to deal with it." The pneumonia-like virus has infected more than 7,736 people and killed at least 170.

entity.name: How Chinese residents on lockdown manage the day-to-day amid the coronavirus outbreak
entity.description: The Chinese city of Wuhan, which is considered to be ground zero for the coronavirus outbreak, is in its 10th day of the government-imposed lockdown. From wearing PJs in public to avoiding hospitals, journalist @amyyqin shared how the city has transformed amid the epidemic.

entity.name: Philippines reports first coronavirus death outside China
entity.description: According to local health officials, a 44-year-old male, who was confirmed as the second person with the 2019 novel coronavirus in the Philippines, passed away on February 1.

text: A 44-year-old Wuhan man who traveled to the Philippines is the first known person to have died outside China from the virus. #coronavirus
